{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3432909,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-09T19:24:53.351Z","cooked":"

Continuing the discussion from VH-109-to-VH-113 Conversion:

Hey @Gabe4!

So to run CA - download and unzip the CA folder. Place this somewhere you will remember it, like your desktop, or an FMS folder.

Open the CA folder, right click on the executable and update it’s permissions to run as admin always. This avoids the windows UI popping up asking you if you want to run it or do something else which I’ve had happen before.

What you do to run CA from here differs depending on what you want to do.

  1. If you just want to play around in general, no access point for robots to connect too or anything like that, then just open the CA folder, and double click the executable to start CA. A terminal window should open and a few messages displayed, probably one saying you need to change your IP address to 10.0.100.5. you can ignore this if you are just testing and updating your CA database file.
    Open a browser and navigate to your machines IP address:8080 or localhost:8080. This is the CA web interface, play around with the setup, add teams, etc …

  2. if you want to connect robots, you will need to change your machines static IP on the Ethernet adapter to 10.0.100.5. Then if you convert a VH-109 to a VH-113 and set up a managed network switch you can run a full field of robots with an FMS

You’ll need a Linksys WRT1900ACS AP that is setup per the instructions from here: GitHub - patfair/frc-radio-api: Minimal API server that lives on the FRC access point and robot radios to facilitate configuration.

Are you using the “old”, white box radios and your own WRT1900 access point?

The CA lite should follow the same instructions and function in the same way, but it’s game agnostic so it removes crescendo specific items.

CA lite also has not been updated to work with the new 6GHz radios yet is my understanding

I am hoping to use the old radios to start with and then move to the new ones at a later date. the reason I ask is because I started with CA and when I saw that there was no manual scoring I deleted CA and moved to the lite version. The reason I want to use lite is that I just want manual scoring and be able to not have to shell out for all of the expensive equipment so I can test everything out and see how it goes to hopefully have something that we can run test matches with when we have fellow teams over and we are all just testing. I like JMS another alternative to FMS because an iPad could be connected and used as a scoring tablet if need be. Thank you for everyone’s help and input. I know I am very picky.

Use this branch of my fork. It will have my most up to date changes You can clone the Repo, Switch Branch, and go build

Cresendo w/Manual Scoring?: try the latest official build 2024:1:11.

This official build was not available for pre-season activities, no cresendo graphics or scoring logic - which is why @Corey_Applegate created this fork for pre-season scrimmage’s is my understanding.

If you still want to run the @Corey_Applegate version it looks like you will have to install GO and build it yourself from source. Check out these general instructions:

image901×603 30.5 KB

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-11-13T18:32:56.524Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":183,"readers_count":182,"score":56.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":472681,"topic_slug":"running-cheesy-arena","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/Team254/cheesy-arena/releases","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Releases · Team254/cheesy-arena · GitHub","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":64491,"username":"Gabe4","name":"I ask a whole lot of questions ","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/a183cd/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/running-cheesy-arena/472681/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3447236,"name":"Corey Applegate","username":"Corey_Applegate","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/corey_applegate/{size}/250858_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-13T18:50:30.737Z","cooked":"

Yes

Be sure to switch to the correct branch. I typically don’t merge my branches to the main. I keep my main equal to the Cheesy origin. This way each year when Pat updates the origin i can sync my fork and add the feature I need or want. Things like 3-8 alliance double eliminations and other creature conferences.

I am running 2024.1.10 official CA.

I just started it up and although it has auto LEAVE, and endgame mic/trap/park scoring, it does NOT have live manual NOTE scoring.

For that you probably need @Corey_Applegate 's fork.

CA does allow you to edit the notes scoring post match before committing the results, but this is not real-time.

Red Scoring

image1281×908 42.2 KB

In match scoring you can simply use the single buton for the amp or speaker. The speaker will get tallied into the correct Auto/Telliop/Amplified

FTA Monitor “Alliance Color”

image1303×839 28.1 KB

The FTA monitor will show the connection status during prematch then flip to that alliances scoring data and amp status

Hey sorry to open up an older topic but I am running @Corey_Applegate freesy arena(and loving it) but I did struggle to get a router working it was one I had lying around but got it to work. But anyways I was wondering what the benefits of the official Cisco switch was for an at home setup? And I’m still working with the old white radios waiting for the new VH radios to come back. Also one other question is how do I best setup a old white radios setup? I am probably going to get the wrt1900acs because I want my home lab router back and not at the lab. But i’m confused on what is needed to run on the router. Do I need to install the open WRT and then the rest API? Or is the rest API not even needed?

Thanks for all the help anyone can give!

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-09-27T01:02:04.326Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":70,"readers_count":69,"score":14.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":472681,"topic_slug":"running-cheesy-arena","display_username":"I ask a whole lot of questions ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64491,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/running-cheesy-arena/472681/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3751101,"name":"Corey Applegate","username":"Corey_Applegate","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/corey_applegate/{size}/250858_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-29T03:34:44.195Z","cooked":"

You might need to use a previous year’s version, since in 2025 all the support for the Open Mesh radios was removed from Cheesy Arena this season.

You could try to re-insert the functionality of the wrt1900acs back into your own fork I suspect there aren’t too many methods that were removed along with the Settings variables to tell the arena what network structure you’re using.

out of pure curiosity, I might look at what this would take. If it can be added reasonably simply, then I could create a Commit that can be cherry picked. NO - PROMISES

Here is the first Commit I found that mentions removing support for Linksys AP

github.com/Team254/cheesy-arena

Remove support for Linksys AP.

committed 04:56PM - 28 Feb 25 UTC
patfair
+6 -31

Looking at the old version of the Wiki

GitHub

Configuring New Networking Equipment

An alternative field management system for the FIRST Robotics Competition. - Team254/cheesy-arena

it maybe difficult to find the alternate install config reverenced access_point_config.tar.gz There looks to be a copy of it in my repo other wise I have 2 of my 3 WRT1900ACS still configured for the open mesh field I could try to get a backup out of.

An option to test your hardware on a Reefscape variant that still had the Open Mesh settings would be to build and run my Week 0 code GitHub - cpapplefamily/freesy-arena at 2025-Reefscape-Week-0 its just a modified version of Crescendo. If that works you can then add the few missing lines of code from the above “Remove support ..” commit to your fork of Freezy Arena and test again. Looks almost too easy.

Here is my current version with the Open Mesh setting added back in. UN TESTED! GitHub - cpapplefamily/freesy-arena at Open-Mesh I recommend though that you simply get a VH-109 and load the VH-113 firmware per your requirements. Vivid has a few sinareos to follow. OR get a VH-113 if and when they are released again.
